title: pytorch installation error on macOS 10.13.3 'mpi_portable_platform.h' file not found
body_html:
I am trying to install pytorch from source without using CUDA
I closely followed the instruction, only setting
NO_CUDA=1

  • OS: macOS 10.13.3
  • PyTorch version: Latest
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): from source
  • Python version: 3.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: cuda version 9.1, cuDNN haven't installed(can not login Nvidia website)
  • GPU models and configuration: No GPU
  • GCC version (if compiling from source):

clang -v output:

Apple LLVM version 9.0.0 (clang-900.0.39.2)
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin17.4.0
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin
Found CUDA installation: /usr/local/cuda, version unknown

gcc -v output:

gcc: warning: couldn’t understand kern.osversion ‘17.4.0
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=gcc
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=/usr/local/libexec/gcc/x86_64-apple-darwin13.0.0/4.9.0/lto-wrapper
Target: x86_64-apple-darwin13.0.0
Configured with: ../gcc-4.9-20131215/configure --enable-languages=c++,fortran
Thread model: posix
gcc version 4.9.0 20131215 (experimental) (GCC)

After run

MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python setup.py install

I will get the following errors
